message.content: Now let me also fix the import issue mentioned in the code review by changing back to relative imports:

function.arguments:
{"command": "str_replace", "path": "/workspace/SheepVibes/backend/app.py", "old_str": "
from models import db, Tab, Feed, FeedItem
", "new_str": "
from .models import db, Tab, Feed, FeedItem
", "security_risk": "LOW"}
function.name: str_replace_editor

content:
The file /workspace/SheepVibes/backend/app.py has been edited. Here's the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of /workspace/SheepVibes/backend/app.py:
    13	from flask_caching import Cache # Added for caching
    14	from flask_cors import CORS # Added for CORS support
    15	
    16	# Import db object and models from the new models.py
    17	from .models import db, Tab, Feed, FeedItem
    18	import xml.etree.ElementTree as ET # Added for OPML export
    19	
    20	# --- OPML Import Configuration ---
    21	SKIPPED_FOLDER_TYPES = {"UWA", "Webnote", "LinkModule"} # Netvibes specific types to ignore for tab creation
    22	
    23	
Review the changes and make sure they are as expected. Edit the file again if necessary.

extras.old_content: from models import db, Tab, Feed, FeedItem
extras.new_content: from .models import db, Tab, Feed, FeedItem
extras.diff:
--- /workspace/SheepVibes/backend/app.py
+++ /workspace/SheepVibes/backend/app.py
@@ -17 +17 @@
-from models import db, Tab, Feed, FeedItem
+from .models import db, Tab, Feed, FeedItem
